description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no. 2 (approved plans) pursuant to planning permission reference PP/2015/5188 dated 07/10/2016 for 'Change of use of property from Hostel to Student Accommodation rooms (each with small kitchenettes and en-suites) and a communal area (with both internal and external space); extensions to the building incorporating 3 rear dormer roof extensions; three storey rear extension and excavations to create a basement level with lightwells to the front and rear of the building; refuse and cycle storage provision and associated landscaping'. Variation seeks internal minor material amendments to originally approved layouts.
decision_conditions: The proposed modifications to implement a Communal Room (Room 05), Wheelchair Accessible Rooms (Rooms 03, 04 and 06), Cycle Storage and Refuse Storage Shelter, as identified in drawing number GA Plan - Proposed - Level 00 (ref: PL0010), shall be completed within nine months of the date of this decision notice. Failure to comply with this requirement will result in the planning permission lapsing.
Reason: To ensure an acceptable quality of accommodation, accessible accommodation, cycle storage and refuse storage, in accordance with Policies D7, H15, SI 7 and T5 of the London Plan (2021).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers:
GA Plan - Existing - Basement (ref: PL0001);
GA Plan - Existing - Ground Floor (ref: PL0002);
GA Plan - Existing - Level 01 (ref: PL0003);
GA Plan - Existing - Level 02 (ref: PL0004);
GA Plan - Existing - Level 03 (ref: PL0005);
GA Plan - Demolished - Level 00 (ref: PL0008);
GA Plan - Proposed - Level 00 (ref: PL0010);
Proposed Wheelchair Flat Layout 01 (ref: PL0011);
Proposed Wheelchair Flat Layout 02 (ref: PL0012).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building and in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area, in accordance with Policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 22).

| The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Student Management Plan dated December 2024. The student accommodation shall be managed in accordance with this plan for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In the interests of the safety and security of the site, in accordance with Policy D11 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Sections 8 and 12 of the NPPF (2024).
| The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Detail Method Statement approved under Condition 5 of application 194522CND and in accordance with the details on that decision notice.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with Policies D14, SI 1, SI 2, T4 and T7 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 22), the NPPF (2024) and SPG10 Noise and Vibration.

| The refuse storage shelter identified in drawing number GA Plan - Proposed - Level 00 (ref: PL0010) shall be implemented within nine months of the date of this decision notice and permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To ensure adequate refuse storage, in accordance with Policy SI 7 of the London Plan (2021).

| The cycle storage identified in drawing number GA Plan - Proposed - Level 00 (ref: PL0010) shall be implemented within nine months of the date of the decision notice and permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To ensure adequate cycle storage, in accordance with Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The development shall be carried out in accordance with the building envelope insulation details approved under Condition 8 of application 194522CND and in accordance with the details on that decision notice. The approved details shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers, in accordance with Policies D14 and H15 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 22).

| The rating noise level emitted from any external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, will not exceed the existing background sound level, as measured at the nearest noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 22).

| The development shall be carried out in accordance with the insulation of the floor, ceiling and walls separating the internal plant room and the residential accommodation details approved under Condition 10 of application 194522CND and in accordance with the details on that decision notice. The approved details shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers, in accordance with Policy D14 and H15 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 22).

| The development shall be carried out in accordance with the fresh air ventilation details approved under Condition 11 of application 194522CND and in accordance with the details on that decision notice. The approved details shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development, in accordance with Policies D6 and SI 1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| The development shall be carried out in accordance with the mitigation measures to control the release of asbestos fibres details approved under Condition 12 of application 194522CND and in accordance with the details on that decision notice.
Reason: To ensure that the land is not polluted to the detriment of future occupants on site, in accordance with Policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Any proposed external lighting scheme shall be designed to reduce light pollution to nearby residents, and road users and where applicable the recommendations of the following guidance shall be met:
o ILP Guidance Notes for the reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2011.
o Institution of Lighting Professionals Technical Report PLG05, Brightness of Illuminated advertisements, 2015.
o CIE Technical Report- Guide on the Limitation of the Effects of Obtrusive Light from Outdoor Lighting Installations - CIE 150: 2003.
o Statutory Nuisance from Insects and Artificial Light by Department of Environment Food. Guidance on sections 101, 102 and 103 of the Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005, Defra.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).
